nevi-me commented on pull request #3940: ARROW-4908: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add support for date/time parquet types encoded as INT32/INT64
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3940#discussion_r266216856
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/datatypes.rs
 ##########
 @@ -195,6 +195,13 @@ make_type!(
     0i64
 );
 make_type!(Date32Type, i32, DataType::Date32(DateUnit::Day), 32, 0i32);
+make_type!(
 
 Review comment:
   The spec only provides for `Date32` to have a day dateunit (http://arrow.apache.org/docs/format/Metadata.html#date). Parquet dates I believe are only represented in 32-bit number of days (https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/LogicalTypes.md#date)

 Review comment:
   this is the schema for "alltypes"
   
   ```
   "id: Int32\n\
           bool_col: Boolean\n\
           tinyint_col: Int32\n\
           smallint_col: Int32\n\
           int_col: Int32\n\
           bigint_col: Int64\n\
           float_col: Float32\n\
           double_col: Float64\n\
           date_string_col: Utf8\n\
           string_col: Utf8\n\
           timestamp_col: Timestamp(Nanosecond)"
   ```
   
   The only date/time is the INT96 one
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

andygrove commented on issue #3940: ARROW-4908: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add support for date/time parquet types encoded as INT32/INT64
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3940#issuecomment-473679955
 
 
   I've updated the parquet data source to handle all date/time types, but the nanosecond readers can never be hit because the parquet crate does not support nanosecond resolution for time or timestamp (see https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/rust/parquet/src/basic.rs#L91-L105 and https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/rust/parquet/src/reader/schema.rs#L215-L221). 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nevi-me commented on issue #3940: ARROW-4908: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add support for date/time parquet types encoded as INT32/INT64
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3940#issuecomment-473684285
 
 
   Thanks @andygrove , that makes sense. We don't yet support v2.6.0 of the spec, which nanosecond came with (https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/commit/b879065ac1bee3fe1d770eb3c4b60ab4267044d7#diff-a557947b7d64dfe5f41d51e1acff9f52).
   
   The `parquet-format` crate is at v2.6.0 (https://github.com/sunchao/parquet-format-rs/pull/3) but I think there might be some work other than timestamps that would need to be done to support the format.
   
   I hadn't thought of that when I expected nano precision, my apologies for that.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nevi-me commented on issue #3940: ARROW-4908: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add support for date/time parquet types encoded as INT32/INT64
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3940#issuecomment-473684285
 
 
   Thanks @andygrove , that makes sense. We don't yet support v2.6.0 of the spec, which nanosecond came with (https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/commit/b879065ac1bee3fe1d770eb3c4b60ab4267044d7#diff-a557947b7d64dfe5f41d51e1acff9f52).
   
   The `parquet-format` crate is at v2.6.0 (https://github.com/sunchao/parquet-format-rs/pull/3) but `parquet` is still at v2.5.0. I think there might be some work other than timestamps that would need to be done to support the format, so it might not be trivial to bump up support.
   
   I hadn't thought of that when I expected nano precision, my apologies for that.

   @nevi-me Ah, OK, thanks. I didn't know that either. Well, at least this part is ready for whenever the parquet crate gets updated.
   
   I would have liked to add a parquet file with all types for comprehensive unit testing but I don't think I'm going to be able to do that in time for the 0.13.0 release since I'm traveling next week. I will create a JIRA for that.

fields.description: The parquet data source does not support reading date/time types that are encoded in INT32/INT64 columns.
fields.summary: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add support for parquet date/time in int32/64 encoding
